What book is The movie Hideaway based on?

The movieHideaway is based on the bookHideawaywritten byÂ  Dean R. Koontz

HideawayPublished by Berkley Publishing Group - 1/1/1992

After Hatch Harrison is brought back to life in an ambulance, his second chance turns into a nightmarish quest to squelch the evil he brought back from the afterlife

Related books / From the author(s)

Hideaway

written byDean R. Koontz

Published by Berkley Publishing Group - 1/1/1992

After Hatch Harrison is brought back to life in an ambulance, his second chance turns into a nightmarish quest to squelch the evil he brought back from the afterlife

Brother Odd

written byDean Ray Koontz

Published by Random House Large Print Publishing - 1/1/2012

Leaving the small town where he has spent his life, Odd Thomas, who lives between the living and the dead, seeks the solitude of an isolated monastery, but he soon finds himself confronting a killer stalking his sanctuary's halls.

Sole Survivor

written byDean R. Koontz

Published by Random House (NY) - 1/1/1997

A catastrophic plane crash. 330 dead, and no survivors. Among them the wife and two daughters of Los AngelesPost crime reporter Joe Carpenter. After years of paralyzing grief, Joe encounters a woman who claims to have survived the crash. He is shocked and has hope.

Fear Nothing

written byDean Ray Koontz

Published by Bantam - 1/1/2012

Afflicted with a rare genetic disorder that leaves him extremely vulnerable to light, Christopher Snow witnesses a murder in the night, a murder only he can solve, that forces him to uncover the many oddities of Moonlight Bay.

Life Expectancy

written byDean Ray Koontz

Published by Bantam - 1/1/2004

A dying man's clairvoyant prophesies about his grandson, Jimmy Tock, reveal five terrifying and horrific events, occuring on five different days at different periods in his life, that will turn the young man's world upside down. 600,000 first printing.

Did you know that the movie Hideaway is based on the book Hideaway?

Hatch Harrison had a traffic accident with his car. At first the doctors said he was dead but then they succeeded in bringing him back to life after two hours. In no time, Hatch starts to have strange sensations and discovers that he is now united with a mad killer who had entered his mind during his death.
